intro: Tibouchina lepidota, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue bracts that resemble petals. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. It produces small, white or pink flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, which are followed by small, round berries. Tibouchina lepidota is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant bracts.
